description: Consider the Diophantine equation x^3+y^3=z^3-1 (x<y<z) or 'Fermat near misses'. The values of z (see A050787) are arranged in monotonically increasing order. Sequence gives values of y.
references: Ian Stewart, "Game, Set and Math", Chapter 8, 'Close Encounters of the Fermat Kind', Penguin Books, Ed. 1991, pp. 107-124.
David Wells, "Curious and Interesting Numbers", Revised Ed. 1997, Penguin Books, On number "729", p. 147.
links: Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..60
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Diophantine Equation - 3rd Powers
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Sep 15 1999.
extensions: More terms from Don Reble (djr(AT)nk.ca), Nov 29 2001
